dt: {bc}a binary compound of oxygen with a more electropositive element or group

shortdef: a binary compound of oxygen with a more electropositive element or group

dt: {bc}a caustic solid CaO that is white when pure and that is the chief constituent of lime

shortdef: a caustic solid CaO that is white when pure and that is the chief constituent of lime

dt: {bc}a colorless flammable toxic compound C{inf}2{/inf}H{inf}4{/inf}O used especially in synthesis (as of ethylene glycol) and in sterilization and fumigation

shortdef: a colorless flammable toxic compound C2H4O used especially in synthesis (as of ethylene glycol) and in sterilization and fumigation

dt: {bc}the red or black oxide of iron Fe{inf}2{/inf}O{inf}3{/inf} found in nature as hematite and as rust and also obtained synthetically and used especially in magnetic materials, as a pigment, and for polishing

shortdef: the red or black oxide of iron Fe2O3 found in nature as hematite and as rust and also obtained synthetically and used especially in magnetic materials, as a pigment, and for polishing

dt: {bc}any of several oxides of iron: such as

shortdef: any of several oxides of iron: such as
any of several oxides of lead; especially : lead monoxide

dt: {bc}a white highly infusible compound MgO used especially in refractories, cements, insulation, and fertilizers, in rubber manufacture, and in medicine as an antacid and mild laxative

shortdef: a white highly infusible compound MgO used especially in refractories, cements, insulation, and fertilizers, in rubber manufacture, and in medicine as an antacid and mild laxative

dt: {bc}a colorless poisonous gas NO formed by oxidation of nitrogen or ammonia that is present in the atmosphere and also in mammals where it is synthesized from arginine and oxygen and acts as a vasodilator and as a mediator of cell-to-cell communication (as between nerve cells) {dx}compare {dxt|nitrous oxide||}{/dx}

shortdef: a colorless poisonous gas NO formed by oxidation of nitrogen or ammonia that is present in the atmosphere and also in mammals where it is synthesized from arginine and oxygen and acts as a vasodilator and as a mediator of cell-to-cell communication (as between nerve cells)
